description: LibriCSS - Continuous Speech Separation benchmark derived from LibriSpeech for meeting-style diarization

source.name: LibriCSS
source.citation: Chen et al., Continuous Speech Separation: Dataset and Analysis, ICASSP 2020

license.name: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0
license.notes: LibriCSS is derived from LibriSpeech (CC-BY-4.0). Academic use requires citation.

download.notes: Download from official GitHub repository. See docs/LIBRICSS_SETUP.md for detailed instructions.

audio_format.notes: 7-channel circular microphone array recordings. Channel 0 is reference.

annotation_format.notes: RTTM files derived from LibriSpeech alignments with simulated overlap

sample_discovery.notes: Sessions organized by overlap ratio (0.0S to 40.0S). Each session is ~60 seconds.

meta.notes: LibriCSS simulates meeting scenarios with controlled overlap ratios. Audio is played through speakers in a real room and re-recorded with a microphone array. Useful for evaluating diarization under various overlap conditions.
